meanings.definition: Matres: plural form of mater, meaning mothers.
meanings.sent1: The matres in the village gathered to celebrate Mother's Day.
meanings.sent2: The matres in the animal kingdom play a crucial role in nurturing their young.
meanings.sent3: The matres in the neighborhood organized a bake sale to support a local charity.
meanings.sent4: The matres of the forest provided shelter and protection to all the woodland creatures.
meanings.sent5: The matres' love and care knew no bounds, embracing all in their warm embrace.

meanings.definition: Matres: a group of deities in ancient Celtic religion.
meanings.sent1: The matres of the Celtic pantheon were revered for their wisdom and guidance.
meanings.sent2: Offerings were made to the matres during harvest festivals for a bountiful yield.
meanings.sent3: The matres were believed to bless the land with fertility and abundance.
meanings.sent4: Legends spoke of the matres watching over the people with benevolent eyes.
meanings.sent5: The matres were invoked in prayers for protection and prosperity.

meanings.definition: Matres: a term used in linguistics to refer to the earliest known form of a word.
meanings.sent1: Studying the matres of language evolution helps trace the origins of words.
meanings.sent2: Linguists analyze the matres of vocabulary to understand linguistic development.
meanings.sent3: The matres of speech reveal fascinating insights into the evolution of language.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the matres of a word is like uncovering a linguistic time capsule.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the matres of a term sheds light on its journey through history.
